sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"使惊愕，使惊讶，使惊奇"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: surprise, amaze, astonish, astound, startle, stun
means: surprise ： 普通用词，多指因未预料或意外的事而引起的惊奇之感。
amaze ： 语气较强，指因认为不可能或极少可能发生情况的出现而感到惊讶或迷惑不解。
astonish ： 语气较强，指出乎预料，意外发生，但又无法解释而感到惊奇。
astound ： 语气强，指由于事情令人难以置信或实在罕见而使人感到震惊。
startle ： 指因突然的惊吓或意料不到的刺激等而使人惊跳或震惊。
stun ： 语气最强，指极度惊讶而目瞪口呆，不知所措。

sentence.Network_en: A matter of repeated occurrence like this will not astonish people.
sentence.Network_cn: 这样司空见惯的事,不会使人吃惊.
我的消息会让你感到十分惊讶的。

sentence.Network_en: He purposed to both charm and astonish me by his appearance.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是想以他的外貌让我着迷,使我吃惊.

list.abs: along with the computer network fast development , specially recently more than ten for years , in each kind of network supply the use the information by the astonishing speed growth .随着计算机网络的快速发展，特别是最近十多年来，各种网络中可供利用的信息以惊人的速度增长。
列举些类似My Goodness!... ... 107 How annoying！ 真可恶啊！ 108 How astonishing！ 真吓人！ 109 How beautiful！ 美极了！.

字典中... ... (2) 区别;分开[ distinguish;divide] (4) 觉得奇怪;诧异[ be surprised;be astonished] (6) 通“翼”。恭敬[ respect].

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent. (as astonished, in the sense 'stunned, bewildered, dismayed'): from obsolete astone 'stun, stupefy', from Old French estoner, based on Latin ex- 'out' + tonare 'to thunder'

entry.def: If something or someone astonishes you, they surprise you very much.

example.tran: 我的消息会让你感到十分惊讶的。
她的奉献精神总是让我震惊。

sentences.sentence: "Your ability to speak six languages amazes me!"

auth_sentence.content: The local prodigy returning...to astonish and confound prophecy.
auth_sentence.res_content: The local prodigy returning...to astonish and confound prophecy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The local prodigy returning...to astonish and confound prophecy.

auth_sentence.content: The most mighty gods by tokens send Such dreadful heralds to astonish us.
auth_sentence.res_content: The most mighty gods by tokens send Such dreadful heralds to astonish us.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The most mighty gods by tokens send Such dreadful heralds to astonish us.

auth_sentence.content: I won't harp or dog, for I know the book is going to astonish and give pleasure.
auth_sentence.res_content: I won't harp or dog, for I know the book is going to astonish and give pleasure.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I won't harp or dog, for I know the book is going to astonish and give pleasure.

Sentence.sentence: That was partly due to his talents: showmanship, strategic vision, an astonishing attention to detail and a dictatorial management style which many bosses must have envied.
But what was perhaps most astonishing about Mr Jobs was the absolute loyalty he managed to inspire in customers
What was the most astonishing part of Mr Jobs's success?
She was astonished by the professional possibilities afforded to young American woman.

means.word_mean: 使惊讶, 使大为吃惊

sentences.en: Her father's sudden death astonished her.
sentences.cn: 父亲突然逝世使她大为震惊。

jushi.english: He was astonished by his mother's appearance.
jushi.chinese: 他母亲的出现使他感到吃惊。

jushi.english: He was astonished to see how his home town had changed in the past 10 years.
jushi.chinese: 家乡过去10年的变化使他感到惊奇。
